user_voice_extracts.note: Initial request - seeking structured values exploration
Focus specification - directs conversation toward decision-making context

user_voice_extracts.content: should i work for consulting or help my small business grow
user_voice_extracts.note: Core decision: Major career choice between employment and entrepreneurship

user_voice_extracts.content: i don't like the idea of working for other people's ideas just for moeny, i usually like being invested in projects i care about
user_voice_extracts.note: VALUES STATEMENT: Reveals core tension between autonomy/meaning and compensation. Prioritizes intrinsic motivation.

user_voice_extracts.content: i feel like i am not afraid to be doing the wrong thing, it makes me feel like i don't really have a job, i'm just doing me
user_voice_extracts.note: PROFOUND INSIGHT: Reframes risk-taking as personal expression. Work dissolves into identity when authentic.
user_voice_extracts.significance: CRITICAL - Core theory of mind about identity/work alignment
user_voice_extracts.interpretive_note: Suggests deep comfort with failure/uncertainty when work feels like natural extension of self

user_voice_extracts.content: yeah, jobs that are natural, personal expressions sure

evidence: Explicit rejection of 'working for other people's ideas'
'i don't really have a job, i'm just doing me' - indicates preference for self-direction
Choosing between entrepreneurship and employment suggests autonomy is decision criterion
autonomy.description: Strong preference for self-determination and freedom from external direction

evidence: 'usually like being invested in projects i care about' - value is in meaningful engagement, not compensation
Willing to take risks (not afraid of wrong) when work is personally meaningful
intrinsic_motivation.description: Work must align with personal values/interests; money is insufficient motivator

evidence: 'work that blends into my life as an authentic expression'
'i'm just doing me' - work as identity extension
personal_expression.description: Seeks work that reflects authentic self; work/life integration through identity alignment

evidence: 'not afraid to be doing the wrong thing'
Willingness to start/grow small business (vs secure consulting role)
No fear of making mistakes when pursuing personally meaningful work
risk_tolerance.description: High risk tolerance when aligned with values; reframes failure as experimentation

evidence: Core tension is between authentic work (business) and inauthentic work (consulting for others)
Repeated framing of work as extension of self vs external task
authenticity.description: Non-negotiable value; inauthenticity is disqualifying even for stability/money

small_business.details: User has existing small business considering growth vs seeking consulting employment

mentioned_in.content: should i work for consulting or help my small business grow

consulting_employment.details: Consulting job opportunity - represents traditional employment path
consulting_employment.alignment: Poor - user values autonomy/meaning, consulting perceived as 'working for other people's ideas'

decision_making_framework.primary_criterion: Alignment between work and authentic self

mental_models.name: Work-as-Identity-Expression
mental_models.description: Work isn't a separate role but an expression of who you are; ideal work is when 'you don't really have a job, you're just doing you'
mental_models.evidence: Multiple statements framing work as natural extension vs external task

mental_models.name: Failure-as-Exploration
mental_models.description: Not afraid of being wrong when work is personally meaningful; reframes failure as part of authentic expression
mental_models.evidence: 'not afraid to be doing the wrong thing' when it feels like 'just doing me'

mental_models.name: Intrinsic-vs-Extrinsic Motivation Hierarchy
mental_models.description: Strongly prefers intrinsic motivation; explicitly rejects extrinsic (money) as sufficient
mental_models.evidence: 'don't like the idea of working for other people's ideas just for moeny'

problem_framing.approach: Starts with emotional/values clarity before tactical analysis
problem_framing.evident_in: Moves from 'help me make values' → personal decision → core values → confirming values match

self_awareness.evidence: Able to articulate deep values quickly; makes profound self-discoveries in brief conversation

domains.evidence: Navigating major career choice; thinking about decision criteria
Core conversation topic; shows sophisticated understanding of what matters to them
Has active small business; considering growth trajectory
Frames work decisions through lens of authentic self-expression; central to theory of mind

patterns.description: When faced with career choice, immediately seeks values clarity rather than practical analysis
Appears across multiple articulations; willing to risk stability/money for self-direction
Describes ideal work as 'not having a job, just doing me' - complete identity integration
Conversation moves quickly from question to articulated values without extensive exploration
Not afraid of 'doing wrong thing' suggests high risk tolerance when work is meaningful

key_decisions.decision_point: Consulting employment vs small business growth
key_decisions.user_stated_preference: Not explicitly stated, but values strongly suggest small business alignment
key_decisions.inference: Values (autonomy, personal expression, meaning) strongly favor small business; consulting would be working for others' ideas
key_decisions.next_steps: Decision likely made by values alignment test

quotable_quotes.description: Memorable, insightful, or profound statements about values, work, autonomy, and meaning

gems.quote: i don't like the idea of working for other people's ideas just for moeny, i usually like being invested in projects i care about
gems.significance: Articulates core tension between security and authenticity
gems.insight: Reveals that compensation alone cannot motivate meaningful work for this person

gems.quote: i feel like i am not afraid to be doing the wrong thing, it makes me feel like i don't really have a job, i'm just doing me
gems.significance: PROFOUND - Captures ideal state where work becomes identity rather than job
gems.insight: When work is authentic expression of self, failure/risk becomes irrelevant; distinction between 'job' and 'life' dissolves

gems.quote: jobs that are natural, personal expressions
gems.significance: Condensed value statement; represents user's ideal work
gems.insight: Seeks work that doesn't feel like work - integration of identity and activity

gems.quote: it makes me feel like i don't really have a job, i'm just doing me
gems.significance: Describes peak work experience - where work and self are indistinguishable
gems.insight: For this person, meaningful work means the distinction between job and personal life collapses

quotable_quotes.meta_insight: User distinguishes sharply between work-as-external-task (consulting) vs work-as-identity-expression (business). Career choice is really an identity choice.

analysis_notes.conversation_quality: HIGH - Short but dense with values insights
analysis_notes.conversation_type: Values clarification and career decision framing
analysis_notes.methodology_notes: Followed EXTRACTION_METHODOLOGY_V2 - extracted all user inputs, values from behavioral evidence, theory of mind patterns, and special focus on quotable quotes
key_observations: User demonstrates sophisticated self-knowledge and values clarity
Career decision is fundamentally about identity and authenticity, not practical factors
Strong autonomy/intrinsic motivation orientation may guide small business choice
Pattern of work-as-identity-expression is core to decision framework
High comfort with risk/failure when work is meaningful
analysis_notes.extraction_completeness: Complete - all user voice extracts included, values grounded in behavioral evidence, theory of mind documented, quotable quotes highlighted
